Message:
When I opened my eyes,
the fog had waned.
The area was still
blanketed in white,
but I could see a figure
hanging their head.

There’s no answer.
The fog’s trapped her
in its prison.

But, now I know the words
I should say to her!

“Your mother’s resting peacefully.
If the same thing happened to you,
you’ll make her so worried she’ll
jump straight out of her grave!

Go on, show her.
Show her who you are now...!”

The fog starts to
thicken once more,
hiding Sabrina away.
But, I’m not worried.

Sabrina’s someone who fights
so that everyone can smile.

The fog is torn apart by
a blinding cascade of light.
